candidates.reason: The comment directly discusses the same steps (binding the receiver to the transmitter using an ESC, battery, and bind key) and mentions specific details like plugging the BEC wire into any port on the receiver, making sure the signal wire is facing upwards, and pressing the bind key before turning on the transmitter.
candidates.comment: This video opens up with the intent behind it, binding an fs-ia6b receiver to the transmitter of a FlySky. The creator goes on to tell you what you will need for this, an: ESC and battery to power the receiver and a bind key that activates the binding state of the receiver. Because of this, you will have to plug the bind key into the last port of the receiver that is used for input power. Then you must take the BEC wire of the ESC, which is the input power to the receiver, and plug it into any port on the receiver. The creator warns to make sure the signal (white) wire is facing upwards towards you. Lastly, he states to then plug the battery into the ESC and then the light in the receiver will begin to blink to represent it is in bind mode. He states that before turning the transmitter on to put all the switches up and the throttle down, press the bind key, and turn on the transmitter to show binding. He then states a few more facts and begins to wind up the video to a close.
